intro: Aegiphila peruviana var. oblongifolia, commonly known as the Andean mountain sage, is a shrub native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It features aromatic, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale purple, typically blooming in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well-suited for rocky or alpine environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and research settings.
